title: [Large-scale] Strategies to Improve Learning Outcomes in Science Programs Through Explicit Response-Demand Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of fundamental scientific theories and experimental methods
context.additional_context: Learners possess intermediate expertise in science, operating in environments enabling collaborative learning with personal devices and immediate feedback

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% accuracy in conceptual understanding of science programs by applying explicit response demand learning strategies.
Learners enhance error analysis skills during the explicit response process for multiple-choice questions.

After a 1-week intensive short-term course, learners can propose solutions applying learned concepts to three new scientific problem scenarios and demonstrate conceptual transfer by achieving an "excellent" rating in at least two out of three formative assessment rubric criteria: clarity, creativity, and scientific validity.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
